message.content: We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. The patient’s symptoms suggest osteoarthritis, and among the options, only Naproxen is a nonsteroidal anti-inflammatory drug that is commonly used to relieve pain and inflammation associated with osteoarthritis. Allopurinol is used for gout, celecoxib is a COX-2 inhibitor that is used for osteoarthritis but carries cardiovascular risks, and infliximab is a TNF inhibitor used for various inflammatory diseases but not typically used for osteoarthritis.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. The patient’s symptoms and X-ray findings are consistent with osteoarthritis. Nonsteroidal anti-inflammatory drugs (NSAIDs), such as naproxen, are the first line pharmacotherapy for osteoarthritis pain. Allopurinol is used to treat gout, which is not the diagnosis in this case. Celecoxib is a COX-2 inhibitor used for arthritis pain but is not the first line treatment, especially given the high risk of cardiovascular events associated with its use. Infliximab is a biologic agent used for inflammatory arthritis, such as rheumatoid arthritis, and is not indicated in this case.

Nonsteroidal anti-inflammatory drugs, such as naproxen, can help alleviate the pain and inflammation associated with osteoarthritis. Allopurinol is used to treat gout, celecoxib is a selective COX-2 inhibitor that can increase the risk of cardiovascular events, and infliximab is used to treat inflammatory arthritis such as rheumatoid arthritis. None of these are indicated for the patient’s condition.

The symptoms and x-ray findings suggest osteoarthritis, which can be treated with nonsteroidal anti-inflammatory drugs (NSAIDs) like naproxen to relieve pain and inflammation. Allopurinol is used to treat gout, which is not suggested as the diagnosis. Celecoxib is another NSAID that can be used, but it carries a higher risk of cardiovascular complications. Infliximab, a biologic agent, is used for inflammatory conditions like rheumatoid arthritis and ankylosing spondylitis, but is not the best option for osteoarthritis.

Naproxen is a nonsteroidal anti-inflammatory drug (NSAID) that can help relieve the pain and inflammation associated with osteoarthritis. Allopurinol is used to treat gout, while Celecoxib and Infliximab are used to treat inflammatory forms of arthritis, such as rheumatoid arthritis or ankylosing spondylitis, which are not indicated in this case.
